alert.note: Alert for Banner; Morrill; Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 7:43PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of western Nebraska, including the following counties, Banner, Morrill and Scotts Bluff. * WHEN...Until 815 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 643 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.25 and 2.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bridgeport, Bayard, South Bayard Junction, Moomaws Corner, The Intersection Of Highway 385 And L62, Chimney Rock State Park, Bridgeport State Recreation Area, Northport, Angora and McGrew. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
